name: Transport, barge, average fuel mix
description: This cradle-to-gate unit process is for the transport of 1 tonne of freight 1 kilometer via a barge. This dataset represents an average barge fuel mix of 22% residual fuel oil and 78% diesel.
category: 48-49: Transportation and Warehousing/4832: Inland Water Transportation

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This unit process is representative of 2019 data.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process is representative of a US barge fuel mix.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most (78%) barges in the US rely on diesel as a fuel source, the remaining barges rely on residual fuel oil or other fuel sources. This model only considers diesel and residual fuel oil.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: The percentage split in this process is based off data reported in the Transportation Energy Databook and industry websites.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: N/A

TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE DATA: N/A

MASS BALANCE: Complete
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data for diesel use in barges was sourced from the Transportation Energy Databook and the residual fuel oil split was confirmed by qualitative data from industry websites.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The data source provided a fuel split of 78% for diesel and 9% for residual fuel oil. It was unclear what fuel accounted for the remaining percentage so it was assumed to be diesel, this was verified with qualitative data from industry websites.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
BOUNDARY CONDITIONS: N/A

DATA COLLECTION: Data was collected from the Transportation Energy Databook

UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATION: N/A
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: The data collected represents the 2019 diesel/residual fuel oil split.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.‚Äù The studies categorized under Goal Situation C1 do consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling. These data are an update to a previously published dataset.

dataGenerator.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

dataSetOwner.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG
